metadata.title: CVE-2022-48799 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:perf: Fix list corruption in perf_cgroup_switch()There's list corruption on cgrp_cpuctx_list. This happens on thefollowing path:  perf_cgroup_switch: list_for_each_entry(cgrp_cpuctx_list)      cpu_ctx_sched_in         ctx_sched_in            ctx_pinned_sched_in              merge_sched_in                  perf_cgroup_event_disable: remove the event from the listUse list_for_each_entry_safe() to allow removing an entry duringiteration.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-lowlatency - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1128-aws - 4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.151~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1122.136~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.102~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
